citation.article-title: Four new species of Chryseobacterium from the rhizosphere of coastal sand dune plants, Chryseobacterium elymi sp. nov., Chryseobacterium hagamense sp. nov., Chryseobacterium lathyri sp. nov. and Chryseobacterium rhizosphaerae sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Chryseobacterium lathyri sp. nov.
(la.thy'ri. N.L. gen. n. lathyri of Lathyrus, generic name of wild pea).
Good growth is observed on TSA, nutrient agar and R2A agar, but there is no growth on MacConkey agar.
Colonies are light greenish yellow, circular and shiny.
The optimal temperature for growth is 30–37 °C.
Growth occurs at 10–37 °C, but not at 5 °C and 42 °C.
The pH range for growth is pH 6–10, and that for optimal growth is pH 7.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–2% (w/v) NaCl within 14 days.
The fatty acid composition is given in Table 2.
The DNA G+C content is 36.6 mol%.
Acid is produced from L-arabinose, D-fructose, lactose, maltose, trehalose, and D-xylose (weakly) but not from glycerol and D-mannitol.

The following compounds are utilized as sole carbon sources: α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, glycogen, Tweens 40 and 80, i-erythritol (weakly), D-fructose, L-fucose, D-galactose (weakly), gentiobiose, α-D-glucose, methyl β-D-glucoside, D-psicose, D-raffinose, L-rhamnose, D-sorbitol (weakly), acetic acid, formic acid, D-galacturonic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, α-ketovaleric acid, DL-lactic acid, L-alanine, hydroxy-L-proline, L-leucine, L-ornithine, L-phenylalanine, L-proline, inosine (weakly), uridine, thymidine, N-acetyl-D-glucosamine (weakly), L-arabinose, D-cellobiose, myo-inositol (weakly), α-D-lactose (weakly), lactulose (weakly), maltose, mannitol, D-mannose, sucrose, D-trehalose, turanose, methyl pyruvate, monomethyl succinate, D-gluconic acid, D-glucosaminic acid, β-hydroxybutyric acid, propionic acid, quinic acid, sebacic acid (weakly), succinamic acid, L-alanyl glycine, L-asparagine, L-aspartic acid, L-glutamic acid, glycyl L-aspartic acid, glycyl L-glutamic acid, D-serine, L-serine, L-threonine, 2,3-butanediol, glycerol, DL-α-glycerol phosphate, α-glucose-1-phosphate and D-glucose-6-phosphate.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon sources: D-melibiose, cis-aconitic acid, citric acid, D-galactonic acid lactone, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, itaconic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, bromosuccinic acid, succinic acid, glucuronamide, L-alaninamide, D-alanine, L-histidine, urocanic acid, phenylethylamine, putrescine, N-acetyl-D-galactosamine, adonitol, D-arabitol, xylitol, D-glucuronic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, malonic acid, D-saccharic acid, L-pyroglutamic acid, DL-carnitine, γ-aminobutyric acid and 2-aminoethanol.
Other properties are given in Table 1.
Results from API ZYM tests are given in Supplementary Table S1.
The type strain is RBA2-6T (=KCTC 22544T=NBRC 105250T), which was isolated from the rhizosphere of wild pea (Lathyrus japonica) growing in a coastal sand dune area.
